entry.et: Middle English cuppe, from Old English, from Late Latin cuppa cup, alteration of Latin cupa tub hive

def.dt: :an open usually bowl-shaped drinking vessel
:a drinking vessel and its contents
:the consecrated wine of the Communion
:something that falls to one's lot
:an ornamental cup offered as a prize (as in a championship)
:something resembling a cup: as
:a cup-shaped plant organ
:an athletic supporter reinforced usually with plastic to provide extra protection to the wearer
:either of two parts of a brassiere that are shaped like and fit over the breasts
:the metal case inside a hole in golf
:the hole itself
:a usually iced beverage resembling punch but served from a pitcher rather than a bowl
:a half pint :eight fluid ounces
:a food served in a cup-shaped usually footed vessel a fruit cup
:the symbol ∪ indicating the union of two sets compare cap 7
:drunk
:to treat by cupping
:to curve into the shape of a cup cupped his hands around his mouth
:to place in or as if in a cup
:any of an order (Pezizales) of mostly saprophytic ascomycetous fungi with a fleshy or horny apothecium that is often colored and typically shaped like a cup, saucer, or disk
:something one likes or excels in I see already that storytelling isn't my cup of tea John Barth
:a person suited to one's taste
:a thing to be reckoned with :matter poltergeists are a different cup of tea D. B. W. Lewis

entry.et: from its former use in ceremonial drinking

def.dt: :a large ornamental drinking vessel with two or more handles
:a loving cup given as a token or trophy
:the optic vesicle after invaginating to form a 2-layered cup from which the retina and pigmented layer of the eye will develop called also eyecup
:indian paintbrush 1
:a cup that has a detachable lid with a projecting hole designed to help a young child sip liquid from the cup without spilling it
:a small serving of drink (as wine) taken by a rider about to depart
:the vessel in which it is served
:a farewell cup
:a cup-shaped device in which a partial vacuum can be produced when applied to a surface
